authors: podar, Mircea [Oak Ridge National Lab. (ORNL), Oak Ridge, TN (United States)] (ORCID:0000000327760205)
description: Starkeya sp. strain ORNL1 is an alphaproteobacterium isolated from the rhizosphere of an Eastern cottonwood tree. Starkeya spp. are physiologically versatile, using a wide range of nutritional and energetic resources and serving important ecological roles in carbon and sulfur cycling. The 6.3-Mb chromosome of Starkeya sp. strain ORNL1 was completely sequenced and will help in understanding nutrient cycles.
research_orgs: Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL), Oak Ridge, TN (United States) U.S. Department of Energy Systems Biology Knowledgebase
sponsor_orgs: USDOE Office of Science (SC), Biological and Environmental Research (BER)
title: Complete Genome Sequence of Starkeya sp. Strain ORNL1, a Soil Alphaproteobacterium Isolated from the Rhizosphere of Populus deltoides
